segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 18. Sañcetaniyavagga
segments.en: 18. Intention

segments.pli: 178. Jambālīsutta
segments.en: 178. Billabong

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: Take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on the cessation of identification,

segments.pli: Tassa sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoto sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati nādhimuccati.
segments.en: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na sakkāyanirodho pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to stop identifying.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso lepagatena hatthena sākhaṃ gaṇheyya, tassa so hattho sajjeyyapi gaṇheyyapi bajjheyyapi;
segments.en: Suppose a person were to grab a branch with a glue-smeared hand. Their hand would stick, hold, and bind to it.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on the cessation of identification,

segments.pli: Tassa sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoto sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati nādhimuccati.
segments.en: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na sakkāyanirodho pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to stop identifying.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on the cessation of identification,

segments.pli: Tassa sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoto sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
segments.en: and their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sakkāyanirodho pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You’d expect that mendicant to stop identifying.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso suddhena hatthena sākhaṃ gaṇheyya, tassa so hattho neva sajjeyya na gaṇheyya na bajjheyya;
segments.en: Suppose a person were to grab a branch with a clean hand. Their hand wouldn’t stick, hold, or bind to it.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on the cessation of identification,

segments.pli: Tassa sakkāyanirodhaṃ manasi karoto sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
segments.en: and their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sakkāyanirodho pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You’d expect that mendicant to stop identifying.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on smashing ignorance,

segments.pli: Tassa avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoto avijjāppabhede cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati nādhimuccati.
segments.en: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na avijjāppabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, jambālī anekavassagaṇikā.
segments.en: Suppose there was a billabong that had been stagnant for many years.

segments.pli: Tassā puriso yāni ceva āyamukhāni tāni pidaheyya, yāni ca apāyamukhāni tāni vivareyya, devo ca na sammā dhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.
segments.en: And someone was to close off the inlets and open up the drains, and the heavens didn’t provide enough rain.

segments.pli: Evañhi tassā, bhikkhave, jambāliyā na āḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You wouldn’t expect that billabong to break its banks.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a certain peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on smashing ignorance,

segments.pli: Tassa avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoto avijjāppabhede cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati nādhimuccati.
segments.en: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na avijjāppabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on smashing ignorance,

segments.pli: Tassa avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoto avijjāppabhede cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
segments.en: and their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno avijjāppabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You’d expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, jambālī anekavassagaṇikā.
segments.en: Suppose there was a billabong that had been stagnant for many years.

segments.pli: Tassā puriso yāni ceva āyamukhāni tāni vivareyya, yāni ca apāyamukhāni tāni pidaheyya, devo ca sammā dhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.
segments.en: And someone was to open up the inlets and close off the drains, and the heavens provided plenty of rain.

segments.pli: Evañhi tassā, bhikkhave, jambāliyā āḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You’d expect that billabong to break its banks.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aññataraṃ santaṃ cetovimuttiṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a certain peaceful release of the heart.

segments.pli: So avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoti.
segments.en: They focus on smashing ignorance,

segments.pli: Tassa avijjāppabhedaṃ manasi karoto avijjāppabhede cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.
segments.en: and their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa kho evaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno avijjāppabhedo pāṭikaṅkho.
segments.en: You’d expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.
